The volume of the solid is determined by the displacement of water in the U-tube.
The change in water level in the U-tube corresponds to the volume of the solid.
The volume of the solid is calculated by multiplying the cross-sectional area of the U-tube by the change in water level.
The cross-sectional area of the U-tube is known.
The change in water level is measured.
The volume of the solid is $7.8 	imes 10^{-5} \mathrm{m}^{3}$.
